text: Barded Nightmare
The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.
Barded Nightmare
The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.
Death Shriek Terrorgheist
Harkon's personal mount is a dreadful thing indeed - a Terrorgheist with a piercing, banshee-like shriek that has the power to stun any who hear it.
Skeletal Steed
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Skeleton Chariot
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Ashigaroth, Gourger Upon the Meek

The dread abyssal ridden by Mannfred von Carstein was known to myth as Ashigaroth. Now reborn as a creature of chill bone in the mortal world, Ashigaroth hunts the living as readily as it ever did the dead, galloping through the skies to follow the spirit-spoor of prey.
Razark, The Doom of Traitors

The dread abyssal ridden by Arkhan the Black was known to myth as Razarak. Whilst other dread abyssals scoured the depths of the Underworld, Razarak always sought lofty perches from which to track its prey. Such behavior was well-suited to its duties, for treachery is best judged from on high.
Nagadron, The Adevore

The dread abyssal ridden by Neferata was known to myth as Nagadron. So voracious is Nagadron that it needs little goading to feast upon other prey, and gorges itself upon the living as eagerly as it did the souls of the dead.
Morikhane, the Black Armour

Nagash's armour is forged from an alloy of lead and meteoric iron. Over the millennia the armour has fused itself with his body, so it may only be worn by Nagash. Obviously, the armour does not prevent him casting spells.
Zefet-netbar, the Mortis Blade

Mortis is a huge magic sword that crackles with unearthly power. The blade was forged and enchanted by Nagash himself and no-one else may use it. The sword increases his already considerable strength, and wounds caused by the sword can be used to heal Nagash himself.
First Book of Nagash
The first book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Second Book of Nagash
The second book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Third Book of Nagash
The third book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Fourth Book of Nagash
The fourth book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Fifth Book of Nagash
The fifth book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Sixth Book of Nagash
The sixth book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Seventh Book of Nagash
The seventh book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Eighth Book of Nagash
The eighth book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Ninth Book of Nagash
The ninth and final book of Nagash's greatest spell tomes known as the Nine Books of Nagash.
Alakanash, the Staff of Power
The Staff of Power was created by Nagash to allow him to store the additional power he needed to carry out his most arcane and dangerous magical spells.
The Crown of Sorcery

The Crown of Sorcery sometimes known as the Crown of Nagash is a magical crown/circlet forged by the great Necromancer Nagash around -1300 IC in his fortress of Nagashizzar in Cripple Peak. The crown is infused with part of Nagash's malicious spirit, partially holding his spirit to the mortal world, and exerts a corrupting influence on anyone who wears it.
Armour of Templehof
A product of twisted sorcery, this construct fuses with the wearer, giving him tremendous endurance.
Gheistvor, Sword of Unholy Power
Whenever this blade tastes blood, its wielder seems to exert greater control over the Winds of Magic.
Zefet-kar, the Tomb Blade
The sword burns away the flesh of Arkhan's victims, leaving nothing but a charred skeleton, bound to the Liche King's dark will for all eternity.
Khenash-an, Staff of Spirits
Created by the Arch-Necromancer, the staff harnesses Dark Magic from deep within the accursed Black Pyramid.
Slann Gold
It is well known that Lustrian gold is enchanted with all manner of esoteric properties; Harkon thinks it will restore his fractured mind!
Akmet-kar, the Dagger of Jet
The blades cursed edge screams with the death agonies of innocents and saps the vitality and fighting spirit of its victims.
Aken-seth, the Staff of Pain
It's wicked enchantments add crippling agonies to any sorceries she wields.
The Carstein Ring
An ancestral ring, set with a gem of deep, sanguine claret that has granted the von Carsteins everlasting Undeath.
Blood Drinker
This accursed blade drinks deep of its victim's blood, restoring vigour and strength to the one who brandishes it.
Blood Chalice of Bathori
The life essence of many wretched, innocent smallfolk ensures that those who drink from this cursed cup thrive with newfound power.
Hellsteed
Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.
Barded Nightmare
The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares - Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.
Chaos Tomb Blade
This cursed blade fills its wielder with an unholy energy, but also entraps the souls of those it cleaves including its former master, binding their jleshless remains in servitude.
Amour of the Barrows

The passage of the ages has strengthened rather than weakened this elaborate Chaos plate armour. Such is the aura of entropy that surrounds it that it has the power to decay the magic of enemy weapons in an instant.
The Black Axe of Krell
When the Black Axe of Krell bites into flesh, it leaves behind jagged shards that swiftly eat their way into the victim's heart.
